column4: Is there a way to configure how big a Gnome terminal will be when you open it?
if you're launching it from a shortcut or something, you can use gnome-terminal --geometry SIZE GOES HERE. See man gnome-terminal
actually, --geometry's explained better in the X manpage, which doesn't seem to be installed by default. See http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/jaunty/en/man7/X.7.html if you want it.
Yeah I figured it out. Thanks for the explanation.
